sorcer.service

Class Job

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorcer.service.ServiceExertion
      • sorcer.service.Job
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, CompoundExertion, Evaluation<Object>, Exec, Exertion, Identifiable, Invocation<Object>, Mappable, Revaluation, Service
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NetJob, ObjectJob

    public class Job
extends ServiceExertion
implements CompoundExertion
    A job is a composite service-oriented message comprised of Exertion instances with its own service Context and a collection of service Signatures. The job's signature is usually referring to a Jobber and the job's context describes the composition of component exertions as defined by the Interpreter programming pattern.
    Author:
    Mike Sobolewski
    See Also:
    Exertion, Task, Serialized Form

      • getFidelity

        public ServiceFidelity getFidelity()
        Description copied from interface: Exertion
        Returns a process signature, all pre-processing, post-processing, and append signatures. There is only one process signature defining late binding to the service provider processing this exertion.
        Specified by:
        getFidelity in interface Exertion
        Overrides:
        getFidelity in class ServiceExertion
        Returns:
        a collection of all service signatures
        See Also:
        Exertion.getProcessSignature()

      • isJob

        public boolean isJob()
        Description copied from interface: Exertion
        Returns true if this exertion requires execution by a Jobber, otherwise false if this exertion requires its execution by a Tasker. Note that control follow exertion can be processed by either a Tasker or a Jobber.
        Specified by:
        isJob in interface Exertion
        Overrides:
        isJob in class ServiceExertion
        Returns:
        true if this exertion requires execution by a Jobber.

      • putValue

        public Object putValue(String path,
                       Object value)
                throws ContextException
        Description copied from interface: Mappable
        Maps the specified path to the specified value in this mappable. Neither the path nor the value can be null.

        The value can be retrieved by calling the getValue method with a path that is equal to the original path.

        Specified by:
        putValue in interface Mappable
        Overrides:
        putValue in class ServiceExertion
        Parameters:
        path - the attribute-based path
        value - the new value
        Returns:
        the previous value of the specified path in this mappable, or null if it did not have one
        Throws:
        ContextException
